title: How to Make Cannelloni with Chicken and Nuts

steps.headline: Roast or grill the carrot and the onion with the butter in a fryer.
Add the frozen spinach, and cook until completely thawed.
Add the chicken, and season with some salt and pepper.
Add the wine  and let it reduce.
Add the nuts-- leave them in for 15 minutes.
Put the chicken mixture in a blender and pulse; leave this to cool.
Add the cheeses, and mix thoroughly.
Melt the butter in a pot.
Add some flour, a bit of nutmeg, and some salt.
Stir the flour mixture continuously.
Remove the bechamel from heat and add the milk.
Return the pot to the stove, and continue stirring until the mixture boils.
Fill the uncooked cannelloni with the chicken filling.
Oil a large casserole dish, and pour half of the jar of tomato sauce into it.
Baste the cannelloni with some melted butter.
Place the cannelloni into the casserole.
steps.description: Be sure to leave enough space between each one, as you don't want them sticking to each other.

steps.headline: Cover with the bechamel sauce.
Bake the food for 40 minutes in an oven at 200.
Sprinkle the pasta with a bit of shredded cheese, and serve hot.
Finished.

text: To make the Chicken Filling Roast or grill the carrot and the onion with the butter in a fryer.  Add the frozen spinach, and cook until completely thawed.  Add the chicken, and season with some salt and pepper.  Add the wine  and let it reduce.  Add the nuts-- leave them in for 15 minutes.  Put the chicken mixture in a blender and pulse; leave this to cool.  Add the cheeses, and mix thoroughly.  To make the Bechamel Melt the butter in a pot.  Add some flour, a bit of nutmeg, and some salt.  Stir the flour mixture continuously.  Remove the bechamel from heat and add the milk.  Return the pot to the stove, and continue stirring until the mixture boils.  Assembling the Cannelloni Fill the uncooked cannelloni with the chicken filling.  Oil a large casserole dish, and pour half of the jar of tomato sauce into it.  Baste the cannelloni with some melted butter.  Place the cannelloni into the casserole. Be sure to leave enough space between each one, as you don't want them sticking to each other. Cover with the bechamel sauce.  Bake the food for 40 minutes in an oven at 200.  Sprinkle the pasta with a bit of shredded cheese, and serve hot.  Finished.
